            Bio
            I am a researcher at the Center
            for Cognitive and Decision Sciences at the University of
            Basel, Switzerland, and a visiting researcher at the Center
            for Adaptive Rationality at the Max Planck Institute for
            Human Development, Berlin, Germany.
            My research is at the intersection of cognitive science
            and machine learning, with a focus on the application of
            large language models (LLMs) to understand human
            cognition.
            I am also involved in educating behavioral and social
            scientists on how they can apply LLMs in their own
            research.
            
            
            CV
            You can download my CV here.
